item.title: Jessica add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found." -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "Health food makes me sick." -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Alice May Brock
item.description: "Tomatoes and oregano make it Italian; wine and tarragon make it French. Sour cream makes it Russian; lemon and cinnamon make it Greek. Soy sauce makes it Chinese; garlic makes it good." -- Alice May Brock

item.title: Jessica add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "Music with dinner is an insult both to the cook and the violinist." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "You can't just eat good food. You've got to talk about it too. And you've got to talk about it to somebody who understands that kind of food." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Beard
item.description: "A gourmet who thinks of calories is like a tart who looks at her watch. " -- James Beard

item.title: Jessica add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "There is no love sincerer than the love of food." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "He who distinguishes the true savor of his food can never be a glutton; he who does not cannot be otherwise." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Training is everything. The peach was once a bitter almond; cauliflower is nothing but cabbage with a college education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "All sorrows are less with bread. " -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "There are only ten minutes in the life of a pear when it is perfect to eat." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by M.F.K. Fisher
item.description: "Sharing food with another human being is an intimate act that should not be indulged in lightly." -- M.F.K. Fisher

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "You can tell a lot about a fellow's character by his way of eating jellybeans. " -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "I am not a glutton - I am an explorer of food" -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Jessica add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook." -- Julia Child

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Elsa Schiaparelli
item.description: "A good cook is like a sorceress who dispenses happiness." -- Elsa Schiaparelli

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jo Brand
item.description: "Anything is good if it's made of chocolate." -- Jo Brand

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Charles de Gaulle
item.description: "How can you govern a country which has 246 varieties of cheese?" -- Charles de Gaulle

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Ice-cream is exquisite. What a pity it isn't illegal." -- Voltaire

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Norman Kolpas
item.description: "Food, like a loving touch or a glimpse of divine power, has that ability to comfort." -- Norman Kolpas

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Laurie Colwin
item.description: "No one who cooks, cooks alone. Even at her most solitary, a cook in the kitchen is surrounded by generations of cooks past, the advice and menus of cooks present, the wisdom of cookbook writers." -- Laurie Colwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin
item.description: "The discovery of a new dish does more for the happiness of the human race than the discovery of a star." -- Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Craig Claiborne
item.description: "Nothing rekindles my spirits, gives comfort to my heart and mind, more than a visit to Mississippi... and to be regaled as I often have been, with a platter of fried chicken, field peas, collard greens, fresh corn on the cob, sliced tomatoes with French dressing... and to top it all off with a wedge of freshly baked pecan pie." -- Craig Claiborne

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Dione Lucas
item.description: "The preparation of good food is merely another expression of art, one of the joys of civilized living…" -- Dione Lucas

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only real stumbling block is fear of failure. In cooking you've got to have a what-the-hell attitude." -- Julia Child

item.title: Jessica add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "What I say is that, if a man really likes potatoes, he must be a pretty decent sort of fellow." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Jessica add a quote by M.F.K. Fisher
item.description: "It seems to me that our three basic needs, for food and security and love, are so mixed and mingled and entwined that we cannot straightly think of one without the others. So it happens that when I write of hunger, I am really writing about love and the hunger for it, and warmth and the love of it and the hunger for it… and then the warmth and richness and fine reality of hunger satisfied… and it is all one." -- M.F.K. Fisher
